intro: Calandrinia feltonii, commonly known as the Felton's purslane, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Mallow, characterized by its hairy stems and fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its succulent leaves and stems store water, allowing it to thrive in arid environments. Calandrinia feltonii is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to full sun.
